mediaList.caption: Needed a second bottle. Fairly priced.

reviews.title: Honest pizza
reviews.text:
Today I ate a delicious pizza Margarita. Everything was right about this simple pizza. Price / quality is excellent!
I only write a review if I really like something because I can cook well myself and am often disappointed when I order something or go out for dinner. So highly recommended.

reviews.title: Nice business!
reviews.text: Cozy restaurant, dog is allowed. Thinking along as a table in the corner, glass of water with a good wine. Those little things. Great!

reviews.title: Disappointed regular customer
reviews.text: For years we have been ordering pizza to take away. On a Sunday evening 2 weeks ago we wanted to eat at the place around 8 pm. We were told that the kitchen was already closed and that we could only take with us. We decided to take the pizza to eat at home. When we went to checkout it turned out that we had to pay the rate of pizzas you eat in the restaurant. After asking why we did not pay the takeaway price (which is more than €5,- cheaper per pizza) we were told that this is an online promotion and that it does not apply to pizzas ordered locally. When I asked what the difference is between a self-pick up pizza ordered by phone and a pizza we bring but in the one ordered at the cash register in the store we got a big mouthful from the service. When we told each other that this was the last time we would order a pizza here we were told when we left the store that it was fortunately the last time. Never have I experienced such an unsuitable person for the hospitality industry as at this pizzeria, she clearly does not understand much about how you treat your customers. Ex. Jeroen Timmerman

reviews.title: Quality
reviews.text:
Delicious pizzas.
Owner very quality conscious and guards it!!!
Personal contact with the customer
The pizzas were well topped.
Dad had never had such good lasagna

reviews.title: Frozen meats
reviews.text: Starter: antipasti, various meats and mozzarella. We actually expected a ball or balls of mozzarella like in Italy, but we got slivers of hard mozzarella. That wasn't a big deal, but what I did mind was that the mortadella hadn't thawed yet! What do you mean from the freezer? I said something about it, but nothing was done about it: no cup of coffee or anything. It cost 9 euros per person, which I thought was pricey.

reviews.title: Forgotten ingredient. No saving grace
reviews.text:
They forgot an ingredient on the pizza.
They offered a limoncello.
We don't like that.
Other than that, no saving grace at all.
Management was not allowed to offer anything else.

reviews.title: Customer friendliness is hard to find. Food is fine.
reviews.text:
Had dinner with the family tonight. We bought 6 vouchers via Social Deal to get to know the restaurant, we thought it was very tasty and cozy.
Reception was friendly and good. We were seated at a rather cramped table, but that didn't spoil the fun. Menus arrived quickly and drinks were delivered quickly. Before anyone had opened the menu, one of our party asked the waitress: "We are here through Social Deal. Can we choose everything from the menu?" The waitress replied: "Only the starter is fixed, this is bread with herb butter. You can also choose ALL pizzas and pastas from the menu. You can also choose from ALL desserts on the menu." Literally asked this question to avoid any further confusion.

Main course was served and everyone enjoyed it. We did miss the garlic sauce with the shawarma pizza (because yes, this is really part of it, but unfortunately!).

When we arrived at dessert, we had all made a choice from the dessert menu. No restrictions, because yes, we had clearly asked the waitress this in advance. The waitress also didn't say anything when we (without knowing it) ordered a dessert that was not included in this Deal.

But now that it was time to pay, we still had to pay for dessert 4 times, which is not part of the promotion. WHAT?! I could not believe my ears. Because... everything on the dessert menu was part of the promotion, right?

We had to pay the full amount (9.50!!) per dessert, even though we had already paid for the dessert via Social Deal. Ridiculous.

The waitress played this out in a pretty devious way. When paying, she supposedly didn't remember that she had said that we could choose from the ENTIRE dessert menu with our Social Deal promotion.

They also did not come up with a solution for this. I can imagine that you charge an additional charge of 1 to 2 euros for a slightly more expensive dessert (because an 8 euro dessert was included?!).

All in all, it means that we paid double for dessert, both via Social Deal and at the Pizzaria itself.

Unfortunately for us not a pleasant experience and will not return again. Too bad, because the food was good. But the peripheral matters must also be in order.

reviews.title: Nearly walked past but very happy I did not!
reviews.text: The restaurant was buzzing on a Friday evening at 19h00. Pizza menu is big enough to for all tastes. In general, pleasant atmosphere, good service and really great pizzas fairly priced. Small but pleasant selection of red wine. Service was prompt and friendly.

photo.caption: Needed a second bottle. Fairly priced.

reviews.title: Fantastic pizza
reviews.text: I've gone here just to eat some pizza, and I ended up in a small piece of Italy in Harlingen. A great atmosphere in a relatively busy restaurant. The waiters were very quick and the food was just amazing. Truely reccommended!

reviews.title: I ended up having more than I wanted, and was glad for it
reviews.text: We wanted to have just a pizza. Or something like it. But we were welcomed, and seated nicely. And then we had drink, and the lasagna was very good. My daughte had oredered something too hastily, the waiter had no doubts, he just had another pizza made without the mushrooms. It was her own mistake, but he did it anyway. So we had dessert. And it was al good, and then I had some special coffee. And we had fun. And I laid down a hefty tip. Without remorse. Thank you, Roma!

reviews.title: Nice Pizza
reviews.text: We came in fairly early, and there were plenty of seats available. We were met promptly and quickly attended to. The staff was both friendly and efficient. We only ordered pizza, so that's all we can comment on, in terms of food. Both pizza's were very nicely prepared with generous toppings and presented, with options of both garlic and chili oil in cruets to spice them up. As we ate, the nearby tables filled up, so it looks like it's popular with locals.

reviews.title: Italian restaurant
reviews.text:
Nice food at reasonable prices in a comfortable surroundings
tables and chairs are a little too close together

reviews.title: waiting for 2 hours
reviews.text: I had a bad experience in this restaurant. We ordered a salad and a pizza to share as a starter and then some pasta to each of us, as a main dish. An small salad with 6 slices of tomato came to our table a long time later. We had to wait almost 2 hours to have the rest of the dishes. The pizza came while we were eating and we were supposed to have it to share at the beginning. Just 3 of the 4 main dishes came. We complaint to the waitress and the manager came in talking to us in a really rude way, when in this case, he should have apologized saying that he was sorry for the delay of the dishes, he just acted really on defensive.

questions.content:
Übertragen Sie das EM-Spiel Deutschland vs. Slowakei am Sonntag 26. Juni 2016, 18 Uhr?

Do you show the soccer match  Germany vs. Slovakia on Sunday, June 26, 2016, 18 o'clock on TV?

Heeft u de voetbalwedstrijd Duitsland versus Slowakije op zondag 26 juni, 2016, 18 uur op tv zien?

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: Family fun in North Myrtle Beach: the ultimate trip planner

seoInfo.metaDescription: From laid-back beach days to sweet memories, find more of what your family loves in North Myrtle Beach. Its sun-drenched shores and easygoing pace offer a well-deserved break for always-on parents and busy kids.

tripContent.title: The Wanderer's guide to Saudi Arabia
tripContent.description: "When Laviai, Marsha, and I set out for Saudi Arabia with "The Wanderer" we had no idea how much this journey would change us. We expected stunning landscapes, rich history, and great food—but what we didn’t expect was how deeply we’d connect with the country and its people. From the moment we arrived, we were met with kindness and curiosity, and when we left, it felt as if we were saying goodbye to a home we'd only just discovered. This guide is our way of sharing our firsthand experiences. Whether you're planning your first visit or just curious about what makes Saudi Arabia so special, we hope our perspectives help you see this country with wide eyes, open hearts, and an endless sense of wonder." – Lina

articleContent.title: Why Greenville, SC is the perfect mix of adventure and luxury

seoInfo.metaDescription: There are few places that blend luxury and outdoor adventure like Greenville, South Carolina. The days (and mild weather) are made for adrenaline rushes of all types, while the region’s spas, fine dining, and boutique properties serve up luxury experiences that last well into the evening. It’s not hard to dive into a handful of the many treats on offer, and crafting an itinerary that incorporates a little bit of everything is how you’ll find yourself with a Greenville-shaped spot forever in your heart.

seoInfo.metaDescription: From slippers and carpets to street eats and pottery, here's how to navigate Marrakech’s souks like a pro.

seoInfo.metaDescription: Set along the northern coast of California, Sea Ranch offers uncrowded, peaceful vibes.

articleContent.title: Your Ultimate Melbourne Summer with AO Travel & Experiences Packages

seoInfo.metaDescription: It’s game, set, and a winning Melbourne adventure for tennis fans heading to the Australian Open in January. With AO Travel & Experiences - the official travel provider of the AO - you’ll make the most of every break in play, stepping beyond the court to discover everything the vibrant city of Melbourne has to offer.
